question.title: What is a characteristic of a painless examination for scoliosis in children?
question.description: A painless examination for scoliosis in children typically involves

option_a.title: A thorough medical history and physical examination
option_a.description: This option involves taking a detailed medical history and performing a physical examination to assess the child's overall health and detect any potential abnormalities

option_b.title: A thorough medical history and imaging studies
option_b.description: This option involves taking a detailed medical history and using imaging studies such as X-rays or CT scans to assess the child's spine for any abnormalities

option_c.title: A thorough medical history and palpation of the spine
option_c.description: This option involves taking a detailed medical history and using palpation (feeling with the hands) to assess the child's spine for any abnormalities

option_d.title: A thorough medical history and radiography
option_d.description: This option involves taking a detailed medical history and using radiography (e.g. X-rays) to assess the child's spine for any abnormalities
